definition: ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
arteries and veins/vein (on a leaf, insect wing etc)

sentences.english: The doctor felt her pulse on her wrist.
sentences.chinese: 这位医生在她的手腕上号脉。

sentences.english: The doctor was feeling her pulse.
As I touched the living Buddha's wrist I could feel his eyes gazing at me expectantly.
sentences.chinese: 号脉时，我感到他看我的目光中带有些许期待。

sentences.english: Put your hand on the wrist cushion. I'll take your pulse.
sentences.chinese: 把手放在脉枕上，我给你号脉。

definition: to feel the pulse (TCM)/Taiwan pr. [zhen3 mo4]
to feel the pulse/to take sb's pulse
(TCM) diagnosis based on the patient's pulse/to make such a diagnosis
condition or type of pulse (in Chinese medicine)
(TCM) interrogation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
(TCM) pulse feeling and palpitation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
to make up a prescription (of herbal medicine)
to apply a treatment/to undertake a therapy
(TCM) observation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
